text.p: Atria Software Inc and Pure Software Inc said on Monday their shareholders had approved a merger to create Pure Atria Corp. The merger will be completed today, they said.

The companies said the merger transaction will be accounted for as a pooling of interests, and the combined company expects to incur a one-time charge of about $36 million in the third quarter of 1996, for direct merger transaction costs, and costs associated with integrating the companies, and other merger related expenses.
A merger agreement was announced on June 6 and was approved by shareholders on August 23 following special shareholder meetings held by both companies.
Each outstanding share of Atria will be converted into 1.54 shares of Pure Atria.
The newly combined company is to be among the leaders in the fast-growing Automated Software Quality (ASQ) market, the companies said.
Pure Atria offers an integrated set of ASQ products designed to enable Windows and UNIX development teams to address the challenges of complex software development, they said.
